sen.j: 家伝によれば、幸家はもと北面の武士として後花園天皇に仕え、後に幸正忠が「宇治幸大夫」と名のって金春流のツレとなったと伝えるが、本来は宇治市猿楽の大夫であった者が、後に勢力を失って金春座にツレ・囃子方などとして参加したものであるらしい。
sen.e: According to the story handed down to the Ko family, the family served Emperor Gohanazono as Hokumen-no-bushi (guards who had their office in the north of the palace), and later Masatada KO became an associate actor called tsure in the Konparu troupe of Noh under the name of 'Ujikodayu,' but in fact, it is said that an actor of Sarugaku (a form of theater) troupe in Uji, losing his influence, joined the Konparu troupe as an associate actor and music player.
sen.cmt: 正忠の読み方が不明です。
sen.e: According to the story handed down to the Ko family, the family served Emperor Gohanazono as Hokumen no bushi (the Imperial Palace Guards for the north side), and later Masatada KO became a tsure (an associate actor) in the Konparu school of Noh under the name of 'Uji Ko dayu,' but in fact, it is said that an actor of Sarugaku (a form of theater) troupe in Uji joined the Konparu troupe as a tsure and hayashikata (people who play hayashi, or the musical accompaniment) after he lost his influence.

sen.j: 宇治の猿楽座はもと幸・藤若・梅松・守菊の四座であったが、早くも天文年間には廃絶し、正忠の子四郎次郎忠能は小鼓の名人宮増親賢に師事し、また金春禅鳳に能を学ぶなどして、金春座で活躍した。
sen.e: There were four Sarugaku troupes in Uji - Ko, Fujiwaka, Umematsu and Shugiku - but they were abolished between 1532 and 1554, and Masatada's son, Shiro-jiro-tadayoshi studied under Chikakata MIYAMASU, who was a master of Ko-tsuzumi, learned Noh from Zenpo KONPARU, and then played an active part in the Konparu troupe.
sen.cmt: 梅松・守菊の読み方が不明です。

sen.j: 宮増が後嗣を欠いたまま没すると、忠能は兄弟子の観世豊次（小鼓方観世流の祖）と座を分って世襲し、小鼓方幸流の祖となった。
sen.e: After Miyamasu died with no successor, Tadayoshi became the originator of the Ko school of ko-tsuzumi players, separately from his senior pupil, Toyotsugu KANZE (the originator of the Kanze school).

sen.j: 子の二世五郎次郎正能は名人として知られ、『幸正能口伝書』を残している。

sen.j: 正能の後は嫡孫清次郎了能が幼少であったため、二男小左衛門一宗が三世を襲い、後に了能は幸清次郎家（幸清流）を興して別家した。
sen.e: After Masayoshi, since his grandson, Seijiro-satoyoshi was too young to succeed, his second son, Kozaemon-kazumune assumed the third headship of the Ko school, and later Satoyoshi started the Ko Seijiro family (Kosei school) separately.

sen.j: 江戸時代には宗家が金春流の座付となったほか、一宗の二男が興した幸清五郎家も宝生流の座付として活躍した。
sen.e: In the Edo Period, the head family of the school belonged exclusively to the Konparu school, and the Ko Seigoro family, which Kazumune's second son started, belonged exclusively to the Hosho school.

sen.j: 幕末期には十二世正員の代に義兄の正孚とのあいだで宗家継承の争いがおこり、維新後の能楽衰退と相まって宗家の権威が衰える一因となったが、高弟生駒秀三郎、三須錦吾（一時芸事総取締）らによって流儀の伝統は守られた。
sen.e: During the last days of the Edo Period, the 12th head Masakazu had a dispute over succession with his brother-in-law, 正孚, and together with the decline after the Meiji Restoration, it became one of the causes of the decline of the authority of the head family of the school, but the tradition of the school was preserved by senior pupils, Shuzaburo IKOMA, Kingo MISU (general director of entertainment for a while) and others.

sen.j: ポ・プ・タ・チ・ツの五種類の音を打ち分け、装飾的な手組みの少ないのが特徴。
